title: South Australia Parliament to Sit on Sunday for Voice Legislation
description: Premier of South Australia Peter Malinauskas at a press conference during a visit to Cabra Dominican College in Adelaide, Australia on May 20, 2022. (Photo by Lisa Maree Williams/Getty Images)

title: New South Wales Labor Prepares to Govern
description: Labor leader and Premier elect Chris Minns with his wife Anna (left) during the NSW Labor reception in Sydney, Australia, on March 25, 2023, after Premier Domionic Perrottet, alongside his wife Helen Perrottet (right), conceded defeat. (AAP Image/Dean Lewins/James Gourley)

title: Cory Morgan: Nothing Less Than a Full, Independent Public Inquiry Into CCP Interference Will Satisfy Canadians
description: Han Dong, now a federal Liberal MP, celebrating with supporters as a provincial Liberal candidate in the Toronto area on May 22, 2014.  (Nathan Denette/The Canadian Press)

title: Alberta Firearms Act to Oppose Feds’ Gun Confiscation Passes Third Reading
description: Hunting rifles and shotguns at a gun store in Toronto, in a file photo. (Kevin Frayer/The Canadian Press)

title: French Police Clash With Protesters Opposed to Farm Reservoir
description: A gendarmerie vehicle burns during a demonstration called by the collective "Bassines Non Merci" against the "basins" on the construction site of new water storage infrastructure for agricultural irrigation in western France, in Sainte-Soline, France, on March 25, 2023. (Yves Herman/Reuters)

title: Snowfall, Heavy Rain in Afghanistan Kill at Least 3
description: A disabled man (C) walks inside his damaged home after heavy rain in the Zari District of Balkh Province, in northern Afghanistan, on March 25, 2023. (AP Photo)

title: Select Committee on the CCP Hears Abuse of Uyghurs in China’s ‘Re-Education’ Camps
description: Gulbahar Haitiwaji (L), a Uyghur who wrote a book about what she experienced while held in two “re-education” camps and police stations for more than two years, and Qelbinur Sidik (R), a member of China's ethnic Uzbek minority who was forced to teach Chinese in separate detention facilities for Uyghur men and women, testify during a special House committee hearing on the CCP on Capitol Hill in Washington on March 23, 2023. (Carolyn Kaster/AP Photo)

title: Michael Zwaagstra: Government Monopoly on Curriculum Limits School Choice
description: Parents drop their children off at an elementary school in North Vancouver on Sept. 9, 2021. (The Canadian Press/Darryl Dyck)

title: Commercial Real Estate Faces Perfect Storm: The Demise of Downtown Office Buildings

title: St. John’s Airport Closed After Late Night Fire Forces Evacuation
description: St. John's International Airport shown in a file photo on January 19, 2022.  (The Canadian Press/Paul Daly)

title: Japan’s Uno Retains World Title to Delight Home Crowd
description: Gold medallist, Japan's Shoma Uno poses with medal after winning the men's free skating alongside silver medallist South Korea's Junhwan Cha and bronze medallist Ilia Malinin of the U.S., during World Figure Skating Championships, at the Saitama Super Arena, in Saitama, Japan, on March 25, 2023. (Issei Kato/Reuters)

title: Security Adviser Warned PM of Public Concerns on Foreign Agent Registry: Memo

title: Short on Planes, American Will Suspend Some Flights to Spain

title: Russia Presses Along Ukraine Front After Reports of Bakhmut Slowdown

title: Rahul Gandhi Expelled From Indian Parliament After Being Convicted of Defaming Modi
description: India's Congress party leader Rahul Gandhi, second left, arrives at the district court in Surat on March 23, 2023. The court found him guilty of defamation for a 2019 campaign trail remark implying that Prime Minister Narendra Modi was a criminal. (AFP via Getty Images)

title: Japan’s Longest-Serving Iron Chef Kenichi Chen Dies at Age 67

title: Dive Expedition to World War II Sub Wreck off Australia Documented
description: A supplied image obtained Mar. 24, 2023 shows a 3D recreation of the I-24 submarine sunk during WWII near Darwin. The journey by archaeologists and divers to document a Japanese submarine sunk near Darwin has been revealed in a documentary. (AAP Image/Supplied by Heritage Minister NT)
